website_summaries.verdict: A lower-priced condenser mic with a few known flaws.
pros: Great for speaking voice and guitar
cons: Background noise sometimes filters into recordings

customer_reviews.title: Best Entry level Mic for its time.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of other reviews talk about the audio quality of it so I won't cover that. What does need to be covered is the build quality itself. Mic is covered in a soft touch coating. These coatings are notorious for degrading over time and becoming a gross sticky mess. This mic is no exception. I've owned it since 2013 and not too long ago dipped the plastic shell in alchohol to break down said coating. The threads on the usb connection point can also be stripped if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: So bad I went out of my way to come back and leave a review.
customer_reviews.text: This mic starts mediocre at best, then in about 20 minutes, it degrades and makes rude noises audible to the person I am Zooming with and on the recording. I narrowed down the noise source, and it is NOT Zoom or my network because I have taken the mic with me to use on other locations and for other purposes to the same result. CRAPPY. Find another mic to buy- even for the same price or less—wasted money. Oh, and in case you wonder why I didn't return it, by the time I realized it was a regular occurrence and eliminated other possible sources for the noise, it was too late to return the mic!
customer_reviews.author: Judy McNutt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work Well With Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microphone because it had great reviews, but it didn't work well with my OS...for thr few moments that it did "connect", it was way too sensitive, even with the 10 db reduction switch. I also went into my settings and put the microphone volume on zero, and it STILL was too sensitive, so much so that I had to hold it 8 inches away from my mouth to avoid distortion. ....it also picked up every noise possible. Like an out of control automobile. One of the oddest microphones I've ever purchased. I have an older model of this CAD usb type microphone and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: For this price I guess I couldn't expect better
customer_reviews.text: This mic is fine...if you don't have professional standards or need clear sound. There is constant background noise, and the quality itself is tinny. My voice sounded tinny, instruments sounded tinny. It was irritating actually. I wanted a travel mic for recording music on the go, nothing fancy. But it couldn't even do that. Maybe its my snobbish musician ears, but its just not worth it. I can imagine it would be fine for certain situations, but if you care about quality and true to sound recordings, this is not the mic for you. Unless you are a very poor student, in which case, it may have to be, and don't worry, it gets better kid.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Newton

customer_reviews.title: Lot of bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audio pro, really just needed something to record with when messing with guitar chord arrangements and lyrics. Scratch-pad stuff. This fits the bill great. Can't believe how much you get for the price. Its not small, and everything has a good quality feel to it, though plastic it may be. Used with Audacity, couldn't be happier. Plugged in to Win10 desktop and was ready to go. Highly recommend for similar or like minded stuff, not a studio pro so can't speak for it from that view, but I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: H. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Huge Step up in Quality vs. My Headset Microphone
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome microphone. I'm a complete amateur, but this is a major step up in quality over my headset microphone. I am recording my audio book (Big Book of Sales) and the quality of sound is night and day better. Go into your settings and change the Automatic Gain Control (AGC) setting. This microphone is super sensitive, but when I fixed the AGC setting - it sounds perfect. I wish it was easier to figure that AGC thing out - I had to watch a YouTube video to see how to do it - but once I got that figured out - it's an awesome piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Findit Guy

customer_reviews.title: 6 Years and Counting
customer_reviews.text: Can I just say I had this for 6 years, and it's still going strong. Use it for streaming, and talking to friends on discord and it's been a little beast ever since I bought it. I've tried to move onto a few mics in between to see if it's an "Upgrade" But those all failed me, including the Blue Yeti. Although this mic went up around 50% in price since I bought mine, I still highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Choxie

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: So, I have some headphonesthat I really love. And, the microphone on these headphones is so so clear but I don't want huge headphones on my YouTube videos. So, I bought this. Well, those headphones are 10000% clearer. This does an alright job, picks up a lot of noise, even with -10db switched on, and that's great. But, even in a completely silent room, I have to use Audacity to remove a bunch of noise (that the headphones don't get). For a live broadcast, I would avoid these. With some editing though, your sound will turn out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Prime

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: Some days it works great. Other times, no. Yes, there is a latency issue. And yes, the light is SO annoying and will not stop rapidly blinking. Solutions: plug it in BEFORE you open up your DAW. If that doesn't work, just unplug and replug. Usually that fixes it on logic. But I know people who have used it and couldn't fix any of the issues. Also, I literally just put duct tape over the light. Honestly, it's that annoying and useless. If you know how to put up with the BS then it's certainly a good value. I've made some good-sounding things with this without hardly spending any money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Low budget Mic.
customer_reviews.text: Been using the CAD U37 for about 3 months now, recording vocals. It definitely works amazing for a 50 dollar mic. If your trying to get the best quality on a low budget, get this, you wont be dissapointed. For best settings: Make sure you uncheck UGC on your mic settings, Input volume between 25 and 50 and set the button on the mic to -10
customer_reviews.author: Craztheking

customer_reviews.title: Good mic - not for professional recording
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on recording an instrument for professional production, look elsewhere. This microphone can definitely catch some nice sounds, but overall quality is not what you would be able to use for a professional recording and production. If you're an occasional singer, or just want to record some sounds for sound fx production, then yeah. Also it's worth mentioning this is a USB mic, meaning, you can't hook it up to your Audio Interface as a regular microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money. Fantastic audio if you use the mic correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Correct usage of the mic is important for best results. Make sure you are 12 to 18 inches away from the mic, speak into the side of the mic, and speak with a normal voice. Sounds great. I use audacity to filter out background room noises such as air conditioning or fans and the results are fantastic. I am not a professional voice over actor but I do use this mic for my job where I narrate elearnings. It is exactly what I wanted. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone for price, category and podcasting!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to podcasting and didn't want to invest a ton of money just in case I didn't like. Turns out, I love it! This is a great microphone for those who are looking for a decent microphone at this price. It's super easy to setup and I've used it on mac, windows, and linux systems. I highly recommend this with the foam cover - worth it! Creates a good radio sound and voice. * Highly recommended for podcasters who are just starting out. * Easy to use and setup * It does pick up a good amount of background noise but nothing you can't edit out * Work well with Skype, Audacity, and other VOIP apps.
customer_reviews.author: jj9068

customer_reviews.title: I hate bright blue LEDs
customer_reviews.text: No longer do I have to have an uncomfortable head set. This thing picks up the birds chirping outside. It picks up the cat's claws on the kitchen floor at the other end of the house, so placing it a few feet away from me is no problem. Using ear buds and this has saved me a lot of discomfort. The bright blue flashing light is quite distracting. You can however mount it upside down and backwards on the tripod to both not sit as high and not have to see the flashing light.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Estes

customer_reviews.title: working well, not plug and play
customer_reviews.text: After some struggle with this mic I am really reasonably happy with it. What I did to get happy: - turn off AGC (in Windows). Now the volume is really quite low. You will have to talk very close to the mic (as in, inches away.) This means I also needed to get: - a side arm boom stand for this mic. Happily the mic holder screwed right into the stand. Yay! - a pop filter. With these things in place I feel I am getting really good sound. It is fun to use now that the setup is adequate for its quirks, and was a good value.
customer_reviews.author: NorthernLight

customer_reviews.title: CAD U37 is amazing! ****WARNING****
customer_reviews.text: I'll let the video review speak for itself. ****WARNING: 2:53 in the video my voice get's extremely loud, please turn down the audio in case.**** To start things off this mic is miles ahead better than my previous Turtle Beach Px 22's mic. It was always muffled, you could hear alot of background noise, fan spinning, laptop fan, anything to make noise you'd hear it. With this mic you can cut almost all of this off and have minimal background noise once optimized on your computer.
customer_reviews.author: PixelBitZombie

customer_reviews.title: the quality was amazing. I believe the problem with the background hiss ...
customer_reviews.text: Not quite what I expected. I had hoped to just record directly into some power point slides, but the background hiss was only slightly less than another cheap microphone I had for years. However, when used with Audacity to record audio and with the Audacity noise filtering, the quality was amazing. I believe the problem with the background hiss to exist in the laptop. The dynamic range and quality of this microphone is great. The stand is very stable. The body and buttons are sturdy. So I believe the mic deserves top ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bienek

customer_reviews.title: Exellent mic, just needs a bit of set up
customer_reviews.text: Very good mic just like the reviews said. I use this to game and to record singing and acoustic guitar. It is pretty sensitive and picks up very little things, and also requires you to mess with the software settings on the computer. Just find the device and hit properties. You should find it alright from there. If you don't want to buy a pop filter, rubber band some paper towers, or a cloths around it. This does not harm the quality of the recording, helps filer out extraneous far away sounds, and, most of all, gets rid of popping. Very worth its price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great entry into prosumer condenser mics
customer_reviews.text: The mic sounds good and the quality is not bad for the price. The mic stand was overly complex to put together, and I can never remember which side of the mic loop mount is up. It's a log tripod and not really adjustable, but if you need something immobile and only about 8" off the surface, this works fine. It does a good job of not picking up machine noise and is fairly directional so just your voice is picked up when in front and it falls off pretty well to the sides. Not bad at all, and for the price this is a fantastic entry into condenser mics.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Williams

customer_reviews.title: crappy mic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic long time ago after seeing many glorious reviews here, but when i tried it out all i got was a low quality muffled sound no matter what setting. My laptop's builtin mic sounded way better than this crap. This does look nice though. Collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: GoodFella

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable voice mike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strictly for spoken word recording (I do audiobooks) and it's a wonderful surprise. Plug 'n' play, it worked perfectly the first time I used it. It's awfully sensitive,but it seems to have a level devil that automatically adjusts the range once it hears the first deliberate sound -- in this case my voice. I'm used to using fancy studio mikes and wondered what I could get for $40. A lot, I'd say.
customer_reviews.author: watchit

customer_reviews.title: A great all-purpose digital mic
customer_reviews.text: Used it with a simple program like GarageBand. It was easy to setup, works great in multiple applications. I use it for a Talk radio type podcast & for recording my guitar live. It has good tonal range & seems to pick up all the sounds very clearly. I don't know the technical info, but I've had no trouble with this mic in my use of it. The stand that comes with it is okay, a plastic stand with a screw tightening mechanicism, I would recommend getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: justinM10

customer_reviews.title: Great for recording audio for online training modules
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this Microphone for over a year to record online training modules. It's simplicity is key, just plug into the USB and start recording. I currently use Adobe Audition to capture the sound, or, an online screen recorder. You'll need to change the default microphone in your "Recording Devices" settings. Quality of sound is great, doesn't pick up a ton of background noise. Much higher quality over built-in laptop microphones and doesn't pick up "lip smacking" that occurs when using headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Fantastic

customer_reviews.title: High quality recordings from relatively inexpensive mic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic based on revues and have not been disappointed. I use it to record narration for slide shows and the sound is of very high quality. It is easy to setup and quickly recognized by both Windows 7 and 10. I have tried other 1/8" non powered plug in mics with big recording level problems, as in not enough volume. This has no such issue. I use Audacity for the recordings and with a few test recordings you can find a comfortable distance and speaking volume to get the results you want without much editing. I do wish there was an on/off switch, but that's not a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: VERY pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this microphone is beyond my expectations! Before I made the purchase, I was torn between this microphone and the blue ICE snowball. But I settled with this one since it seems to pick up the sounds much better and I don't have to come close to it when I record. Didn't turn super hot when its recording or anything. The audio came out very crisp. Surprisingly, it doesn't pick up background noises! So I recommend anyone who's looking for a microphone for live stream gaming, recording, projects, to get this mic!! Your money will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is very clear, very good quality. It sounds like a microphone my brother paid over $80 for, but is at only a fraction of the price! I recommend it! (I also purchased it directly from Amazon.) EDIT: It is a VERY sensitive microphone, so if you don't want to blow the mic out while singing, I suggest lowering the mic levels on your computer and NOT standing directly in front of it. (Take note, however--this is coming from a LOUD singer. If you're a softer singer, I'd suggest you experiment a little bit more with the levels.) Experiment with different placements, and see what works for you. I still am extremely satisfied. :)
customer_reviews.author: i breathe air

customer_reviews.title: Good for basic recordings but audio editing is a must for better quality
customer_reviews.text: A reliable and cheap microphone. It serves its purpose and I am able to get some recordings done. However, everything I record has a nasty "hiss" sound behind it emanating from the quiet environment where I record. Audio editing and touch-ups are an absolute must for this microphone. Fortunately programs like Audacity are free and there are many tutorials on YouTube to learn how to take advantage of it. Still, it would be a lot easier if the microphone was better at filtering out the annoying non-sounds
customer_reviews.author: Parker Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Crisp, clear sound at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I had an opportunity to use a directional recording mic at work. The sound quality from that thing was amazing. Having compared it to the recordings I've done with my headset and webcam mics, I decided it was time to order one made specifically for recording. So far, I have been very pleased with the sound quality of this microphone. Cons are (1) no on/off switch on the mic, (2) stand is a little rudimentary. Still, I am happy with it, and I would buy it again. Now, I'm thinking about buying a pop filter and a shock mount...
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, but doesn't play nicely with my Windows 8 laptop
customer_reviews.text: The sound reproduction I get from this mic is terrific. Unfortunately, I can't use it for anything other than narrating PowerPoints (or otherwise recording one-way); as soon as I try to use any other sound feature on my computer, nothing works. I tried using this to have online classes with my grad students, but although they could hear me, I couldn't hear them; when I disconnected it, I couldn't even get the mic in my computer to respond. Had to shut down and restart Windows 8. Plug-and-play stuff shouldn't be so complicated. I just want it to work, so I can use it for my distance-ed classes.
customer_reviews.author: Dr W

customer_reviews.title: Fine for the price, but
customer_reviews.text: Be aware this thing has an extremely bright LED on the front that blinks whenever it hears something. Gaming in a dark room with it was so unbearable that I had to cover the LED with roofing tar. Does the job and looks decent. I only wanted it for voice chat in games. Sound is clear but lacking in the fine details. I wouldn't use it to record music. The blue snowball is much better quality for the price, but that one was too ugly to be a permanent fixture on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Himeko Inaba

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just as good if not better than a yeti. If you are looking for a desktop mic you probably have heard of the Blue Yeti that everyone raves about. The quality of this microphone is astounding. I have purchased a few different mics in this price range and was ready to give up, until I saw the reviews of this one. I use this mic for making technical training videos and live streaming on twitch, The quality is excellent. Cons: I wish it had a mute or off button on the side. It has a bass-reduction switch and a overload-protection switch, but not on/off. So I just pull the cord when I want to mute it for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Marz

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mic
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for Skype and livestreaming for a while now and it's a really nice microphone. It can be turned up very sensitive and has much better audio quality than any headset I've ever used. It uses and comes with a mini (not micro) USB hookup, which aren't as common nowadays, but always feel like much more secure connections to me. However as a warning, the directionality of its response is not as drastic as i'd hoped; getting it to pick up my voice, but not my loud IBM keyboard is elusive.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Gives you a good baseline to work with, just don't expect a ton of quality or customization options
customer_reviews.text: Works well for non-professional recording. Don't expect to get more than you pay for. I used this for volunteering to record audiobooks on Audacity, and it worked just fine for that. I also used it to record some of my music. There is some adjustment possible with this mic, like the angle the mic is standing at and the -10dB option. Most of the relevant settings are going to be accessible in your recording software. This mic gives you a good baseline to work with, and that's what you're paying for.
customer_reviews.author: T. Blikstad

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Recording anything on this mic sounds great. I don't have a pop filter, and I'm just using the standard tripod, but this thing blows my previous cheap mic out of the water. However, this is a studio microphone and not meant for voice chatting on Discord or Skype. I mostly use it for that purpose and it does a great job, but it picks up every bit of noise, including PC fans, keyboards (I have a mechanical), and everything else you can imagine. I can't fault the mic for this though, so I give it a 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My recordings come out really nice, although if i were to have the AC ...
customer_reviews.text: I do youtube videos, and also record music once a while. If you are under a budget, i must say that this is worth its price and the quality to be considered a "basic microphone" definitely exceeded my expectations. My recordings come out really nice, although if i were to have the AC on at full blast it might capture it a bit (i have a wall AC so you can imagine how loud those are) Al thought it has no more than 4 settings you cna play with and mix around with, I honestly dont more than that for a flawless piece of recording. Totally recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: MamaBearsPath

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful product for home audio projects.
customer_reviews.text: The CAD U37 has performed beyond my wildest expectations. I never realized a mike of this caliber could be found in this price range. It arrived quickly and in excellent condition. It sets up basically as a plug-and-play item. But the audio response of this mike is amazing. I'd benn fighting mediocre voice files for a program I'm writing/ Once I received the U37, all my audio problems went away. An outstanding mike with 2 switches for added control: sensitivity and bass response. I highly recommend the U37 for any serious audio recording.
customer_reviews.author: Harold W. Crean

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is quite good. I'm not doing anything amazeballs with it. I'm reading books. However, it captures sound VERY well. I had to set up my closet as my sound booth because of all the other noises it picks up. People recommend you make a sound booth anyway, so that's not a gripe. At all. The tripod is a bit wibbly-wobbly when you have a pop screen attached to it. I do recommend GETTING a pop screen. It's well worth the investment. If you're test-driving the recording idea, start here. If you decide to be serious about it, I'd recommend investing in a sturdier stand.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Allen

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Works Great with Dragon Naturally Speaking
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent condenser-type microphone that works very well with Dragon Dictate and for recording audio for books, podcasts, or videos. The price is far below premium mikes like the Blue Yeti, yet this works just as well. I've used mine for multiple projects and the audio always comes through rich and clear. It also works like magic with Dragon Dictate, which can be grumpy when you use a sub-standard microphone. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ancient Grey-bearded Reader

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price can't be beat on this mic
customer_reviews.text: A great quality mic for a great price. I was looking into mics to start a podcast with. Everyone recommended Blue Yeti, but I couldn't afford it for something that ultimately wasn't anything more than a pet project. So I ended up with this mic. It works excellently. I plugged it in and started up audacity, and tested it out. It sounded beautiful and crisp. It also seems to be very good quality, nothing seems cheap or loose. So if you're wanting to break into recording, music, podcasting for cheap, but still want quality, this is the mic for you.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: I needed a good microphone for livestreaming and recording YouTube videos
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good microphone for livestreaming and recording YouTube videos, and this is a pretty good microphone. The sound is clear. I thought the plastic stand was going to give me trouble, but it actually works really well. My only problem with the stand is that it's very light, so if you clamp on a moderately heavy pop filter (like I did), it's prone to tipping over if you don't balance it carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: loud Frying static sound
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed I bought it about a month ago. But I tried using it for the first time today. Im very hurt. It has a distirted frying sound. I tried 3 new cables and get the same results. Im sending it back. whats worst I jus passed the 30 day return period. I must have gotten a bad 1 because I heard alot of good things b4 I bought it.... Im outta some good hard earned cash.
customer_reviews.author: primetime

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with Various Audio Recording Software.
customer_reviews.text: Damn good PC recording mic. Works with various audio recording software. Tested with Magix MX Music Maker for Windows (which I purchased here on Amazon), Audacity* for Windows, Audacity* for Mac, and Garage Band for Mac. Works great with all of them. *Audacity is a FREE and open-source (Windows/Mac/Linux compatible) audio recording software for adding live instruments and vocals to pre-recorded background music. It also includes different effects, such as: old-time radio, megaphone, CB sound, echo, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Nathan T. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: It was a workhorse... But I've put it out to pasture now...
customer_reviews.text: 3 of the 5 years I've been on YouTube, this was my microphone. It did its job well. The sound quality wasn't the greatest thing ever, but certainly a step up from the built-in microphones that I started with. This mic is cost-effective and functional. You won't get studio-quality sound out of it, but most people don't require it. I'm amazed that it lasted as long as it did, and it still has life yet to live. For the price? You certainly can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: This microphone sounds great. I don't know too much about them
customer_reviews.text: This microphone sounds great. I don't know too much about them, but I can say that as a complete layperson, the difference between this and the cheaper microphone it replaces made by Logitech, the difference is monumental. I use it to narrate videos and for gaming, and I actually sound like a person talking, not some fuzzy robot.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Quick and simple setup with decent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do a few recordings in the field with my laptop and it has worked out well. Not needing any other power supply or preamp is nice. It's certainly not the best mic I have ever used, but for a direct USB field mic, it does the job well. The stand that comes with it works just fine for most situations. I'm sure I will find more reasons to use this mic now that I have it, since it is so portable and easy to setup. Just plug it in, open your DAW software and off you go. No fuss.
customer_reviews.author: BigMikeSndTech

customer_reviews.title: which I like. However
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality recording hardware for the price. All you have to do is plug it in and you're ready to record whatever you please. The stand is solid, the microphone audio is crystal clear, and it looks very understated, which I like. However, the microphone is very sensitive. Almost too sensitive. When playing online games, I have to wear headphones or else this microphone will pick up the speakers from the sides of the room, even at very low volumes. Also, the front-set blue LED flashes when in use, and is very annoying. I put a piece of black electrical tape over mine.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Good microphone but manufacturer's information unclear on frequency response range.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice microphone for the price, with good strong, clear pickup for voice and musical instrument recording. There is a discrepancy with the manufacturer's information, however. On their website, they state that the microphone has a 20Hz - 20KHz frequency response range, but in the little manual packaged with the microphone, it says that it only has 40Hz - 18KHz response range. For voice recording, this won't matter, but for some instrument recording, it might.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hulshizer, MS, MA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, high quality, much better than built-in PC/Mac audio mic in
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent, well designed, super quality low-priced mic, with an unusually long USB cord for ease of placement. Pairs instantly and easily with MacOS. Highly recommend. I've been using this mic daily for making youtube product reviews, a clear step up from just your computer's built in recording mic input. Listen to the product review and listen closely to the difference! The only down sides are an obnoxiously large and bright rapid-blinking blue LED to indicate the mic is being used to capture audio.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: A great condenser mic that's high quality and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for creating some foley sound effects, and VO recording for our indie game studio, and it's been a really impressive, affordable mic so far. After building a DIY soundbooth, we've had crystal clear recordings so far with this condenser mic to our delight. I'm honestly no audio pro or anything, but this has done the job we needed very well so I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K

customer_reviews.title: Better than average, but not by much
customer_reviews.text: Sounds a little thin and weak, maybe slightly better than any other USB computer mic you'd find off the shelf. I like that it has an attenuation switch but I don't think I'd want to use it for recording. It's very lightweight, which is great for travel, but it feels very cheap and the stand is flimsy. It's also not a standard form factor for a mic stand, and the mic itself isn't designed for a standard base, so it can be tricky to replace if the plastic cracks.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: my old headset mic would sound all weird messing my voice a little and easily spike if i raised my voice but with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Loving the sound on this little beast, my old headset mic would sound all weird messing my voice a little and easily spike if i raised my voice but with this i can scream and it doesn't hurt my ears listening to it afterwards xD awesome, love the -10 decibles option it has, helps a ton. and the stand it comes with ain't all that great but hey it's free man ^^
customer_reviews.author: isaias b.

customer_reviews.title: This Mic is a game changer
customer_reviews.text: This Mic is truly a game changer. I use this mic in a pod casting booth so it is very handy in expensive but powerful. If you are doing podcasting I would strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Microphone

product_meta.title: CAD Audio U37 USB Studio Condenser Recording Microphone
product_meta.description:
Record studio-quality audio directly to your computer via USB with the CAD U37 side-address condenser microphone-a great choice for both vocal and instruments as well as for creating podcasts and voiceovers for videos. Compatible with both Windows and Mac OS operating systems, you can simply plug the U37 into your PC and start recording. The U37 has two switches on the front. The first switch allows you to decrease the sensitivity of the microphone so the sound quality is clear for extremely loud sounds. For example, the switch should be in the "-10" position for loud voices, percussion and other high sound pressure level devices. The "0" position should be used for normal voices and string instruments. The second switch on the U37 is designed to reduce pickup of deep-bass sounds. The switch should be in the "Normal Bass" mode in most cases. However, if you want to remove wind noise, ventilation noise, or decrease the low frequencies in a recording, the switch should be in the "Bass Reduction" position.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


USB Studio Recording Microphone
 * Record studio-quality audio directly to your computer 
 * Excellent for vocals and instruments 
 * Podcast over the internet 
 * Create your own audio for video 
 * Record your own songs 
 * Simply plug in and start recording 
 * Windows and Macintosh compatible 

Applications
Studio Vocals, Speech, Instruments, Podcasts, Desktop Recording 

U37 Features and Benefits
 * Large condenser microphone element for warm, rich recordings 
 * Cardioid pick-up pattern minimizes background noise and isolates the main sound source 
 * Smooth, extended frequency response is excellent for singing, speech and instruments 
 * -10dB overload-protection switch minimizes distortion from loud sound sources 
 * Bass-reduction switch reduces room noise 
 * Side-address design used by broadcast, TV and recording studios 
 * Ten-foot USB cable for flexible mic placement 
 * Desktop mic stand included
